greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n (n>=0) gives the first n terms of A000041.
comment: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts with maximal size, see A000009. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 13 2009
It appears that T(n,k) is also the total number of occurrences of j in the last j sections of n+1, where j = n-k+1 (cf. A182703). - _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 07 2012
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (first 50 rows)
Francesca Aicardi, Matricial formulas for partitions, arXiv:0806.1273 [math.NT], 2008. [Note that there is an error in the triangle given there.]
xref: Mirror of triangle A027293. - _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 07 2012
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 10 2008, based on a suggestion from _Gary W. Adamson_
